## API

MediaXML modules that provide atomic classes and views for various XML documents.


### adi

[adi.js:419-427][143]

-   **See: [https://community.cablelabs.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/cablelabs/alfresco/download?id=8f900e8b-d1eb-4834-bd26-f04bd623c3d2][144]
    **

#### Examples

```javascript
const adi = require('mediaxml/adi')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('./package.xml')
const document = adi.createDocument(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.metadata)
  for (const asset of document.asset.assets) {
    console.log(asset.metadata, asset.appData)
  }
})
```

#### Document

[adi.js:23-112][145]

**Extends AbstractDocument**

A class that represents an ADI document with special
entity access.

##### Parameters

-   `input` **(adi.Document | Parser | [String][146] | ReadableStream)** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const fs = require('fs')
const stream = fs.createReadStream('./package.xml')
const document = Document.from(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.metadata)
  console.log(document.asset)
})
```

### adi3

[adi3.js:1168-1185][187]

-   **See: [https://scte-cms-resource-storage.s3.amazonaws.com/ANSI_SCTE-35-2019a-1582645390859.pdf][188]
    **

A module to provide atomic classes for working with ADI3 documents.

#### Examples

```javascript
const adi3 = require('mediaxml/adi3')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('./package.xml')
const document = adi3.createDocument(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  for (const asset of document.assets) {
  }
})
```

#### Document

[adi3.js:22-195][189]

**Extends adi.Document**

An extended `Document` that represents an ADI3 document with special
entity access.

##### Parameters

-   `input` **([Document][157] | Parser | [String][146] | ReadableStream)** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const fs = require('fs')
const stream = fs.createReadStream('./package.xml')
const document = Document.from(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.metadata)
  console.log(document.asset)
})
```

### rss

[rss.js:805-815][263]

-   **See: [https://validator.w3.org/feed/docs/rss2.html][264]
    **

A module to provide atomic classes for working with RSS documents.

#### Examples

```javascript
const rss = require('mediaxml/rss')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('./feed.rss')
const document = rss.createDocument(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  const { channel } = document
  console.log(channel.name, channel.description)
  for (const item of channel.items) {
    console.log(item)
  }
})
```

#### Document

[rss.js:22-139][265]

**Extends AbstractDocument**

An extended `Document` that represents a RSS document with special
entity access.

##### Parameters

-   `input` **([Document][157] | Parser | [String][146] | ReadableStream)** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const fs = require('fs')
const stream = fs.createReadStream('./feed.rss')
const document = Document.from(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.channel.items)
})
```

### mrss

[mrss.js:2653-2691][335]

-   **See: [https://www.rssboard.org/media-rss][336]
    **

A module to provide atomic classes for working with mRSS documents.

#### Examples

```javascript
const mrss = require('mediaxml/mrss')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('./feed.rss')
const document = mrss.createDocument(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  const { channel } = document
  console.log(channel.name, channel.description)
  for (const item of channel.items) {
    console.log(item.mediaContent)
  }
})
```

### xmltv

[xmltv.js:1261-1281][555]

-   **See: [http://wiki.xmltv.org/index.php/XMLTVFormat][556]
    **
-   **See: [https://github.com/XMLTV/xmltv/blob/master/xmltv.dtd][557]
    **

A module to provide atomic classes for working with XMLTV documents.

#### Examples

```javascript
const xmltv = require('mediaxml/xmltv')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('./epg.xml')
const document = xmltv.createDocument(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.channels)
  for (const programme of document.programmes) {
   console.log(programme.title, programme.start, programme.stop)
  }
})
```

#### Document

[xmltv.js:26-255][558]

**Extends AbstractDocument**

An extended `Document` that represents an XMLTV document with special
entity access.

##### Parameters

-   `input` **([Document][157] | Parser | [String][146] | ReadableStream)** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const fs = require('fs')
const stream = fs.createReadStream('./epg.xml')
const document = Document.from(stream)

document.ready(() => {
  console.log(document.channels)
  console.log(document.programmes)
})
```

##### sourceInfoURL

Type: [string][146]?

## Core

Core modules for implementing the MediaXML API.


### parser

[parser.js:2613-2625][654]

The core parsing API for the MediaXML module that creates a document
object model for a parsed XML file with a robust query API built on top
of [JSONata][655].

#### Examples

```javascript
const { Parser } = require('mediaxml/parser')
const fs = require('fs')

const stream = fs.createReadStream('package.xml') // ADI
const parser = Parser.from(stream)
parser.then(() => {
  const { rootNode } = parser
  const assets = parser.query('**[name="asset"]') // get all '<Asset />' nodes
})
```

#### ParserNode

[parser.js:578-1638][685]

A container for a parsed XML node with references to
its parent node and children.

##### Parameters

-   `name` **[String][146]** 
-   `attributes` **[Object][147]?** 
-   `depth` **[Number][432]?** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const metadata = ParserNode.from('Metadata')
const appData = ParserNode.from('App_Data', { app: 'SVOD', name: 'Type', value: 'title' })
metadata.appendChild(appData)

console.log(metadata)
// <Metadata>
//   <App_Data app="SVOD" name="Type" value="title" />
// </Metadata>
```

##### innerXML

[parser.js:853-853][686]

The inner XML representation of this node.
Setting the inner XML of this node will update body and children
of this node instance. If a string is given,
it is parsed and the body and children of this node will
be updated. If a `ParserNode` instance is given, or an array of
them, the children will be updated to include those nodes.

Type: [String][146]

###### Examples

```javascript
const node = ParserNode.from('rss', {
 'xmlns:atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom',
 'xmlns:media': http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/',
 'version': '2.0'
})

node.innerXML = `
  <channel>
    <title>Calm Meditation</title>
    <link>http://sample-firetv-web-app.s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com</link>
    <language>en-us</language>
    <pubDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2018 16:19:56 -0700</pubDate>
    <lastBuildDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2018 16:19:56 -0700</lastBuildDate>
    <managingEditor>tomjoht@gmail.com (Tom Johnson)</managingEditor>
    <description>Contains short videos capturing still scenes from nature with a music background, intended for calming or meditation purposes. When you're stressed out or upset, watch a few videos. As your mind focuses on the small details, let your worries and frustrations float away. The purpose is not to entertain or to distract, but to help calm, soothe, and surface your inner quiet. The videos contain scenes from the San Tomas Aquinas trail in Santa Clara, California.</description>
  </channel>
`

console.log(node)
// <rss xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" version="2.0">
//  <channel>
//    <title>Calm Meditation</title>
//    <link>http://sample-firetv-web-app.s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com</link>
//    <language>en-us</language>
//    <pubDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2018 16:19:56 -0700</pubDate>
//    <lastBuildDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2018 16:19:56 -0700</lastBuildDate>
//    <managingEditor>tomjoht@gmail.com (Tom Johnson)</managingEditor>
//    <description>Contains short videos capturing still scenes from nature with a music background, intended for calming or meditation purposes. When you're stressed out or upset, watch a few videos. As your mind focuses on the small details, let your worries and frustrations float away. The purpose is not to entertain or to distract, but to help calm, soothe, and surface your inner quiet. The videos contain scenes from the San Tomas Aquinas trail in Santa Clara, California.</description>
//  </channel>
// </rss>
```

##### outerXML

[parser.js:915-915][687]

The outer XML representation of this node.
Setting the outer XML of this node will update the attributes,
name, and children of this node instance. If a string is given,
it is parsed and will represent the new node If a `ParserNode`
instance is given it will be used to derive the node's new state.

Type: [String][146]

###### Examples

```javascript
const node = ParserNode.empty()
node.outerXML = `
 <rss xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" version="2.0">
   <channel>
     <title>Calm Meditation</title>
     <link>http://sample-firetv-web-app.s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com</link>
     <description>Contains short videos capturing still scenes from nature with a music background, intended for calming or meditation purposes. When you're stressed out or upset, watch a few videos. As your mind focuses on the small details, let your worries and frustrations float away. The purpose is not to entertain or to distract, but to help calm, soothe, and surface your inner quiet. The videos contain scenes from the San Tomas Aquinas trail in Santa Clara, California.</description>
   </channel>
 </rss>
`
```

##### from

[parser.js:2001-2003][795]

Create a new `ParserOptions` instance.

###### Parameters

-   `opts` **([Object][147]? | ParserOptions)** 
    -   `opts.bindings` **[Object][147]?** JSONata query function bindings (optional, default `null`)
    -   `opts.handler` **ParserHandler?** Parser runtime handler functions (optional, default `null`)
    -   `opts.state` **ParserState?** Initial parser state (optional, default `null`)
    -   `opts.xmlMode` **[Boolean][436]** Enable/disable XML mode for internal parser (optional, default `true`)
    -   `opts.lowerCaseTags` **[Boolean][436]** Lowercase parsed tag names (optional, default `false`)
    -   `opts.decodeEntities` **[Boolean][436]** Decode entities in parsed nodes (optional, default `true`)
    -   `opts.recognizeCDATA` **[Boolean][436]** recognize (optional, default `true`)

###### Examples

```javascript
const options = ParserOptions.from({
  preserveConsecutiveUppercase: true,
  lowerCaseAttributeNames: true,
  bindings: {
    // `$propercase(string: String)`: String - convert string in query to propercase
    propercase(string) {
      return string[0].toUpperCase() + string.slice(1)
    }
  }
})
```

Returns **ParserOptions**

### document

[document.js:241-247][815]

-   **See: [ParserNode][816]
    **

A core module for working with and building XML documents. The
interfaces provided by this module are porcelain and be used instead
of the [_parser API_][92].

#### Examples

```javascript
const { createDocument, createNode } = require('mediaxml/document')

const assets = []
const document = createDocument(`
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<package>
  <assets />
</package>
`)

assets.push(createNode('asset', {
  name: 'first',
  url: 'https://example.com/first.mp4'
}))

assets.push(createNode('asset', {
  name: 'second',
  url: 'https://example.com/second.mp4'
}))

document.query('[name="assets"]').append(...assets)

console.log(document)
// <package>
//   <assets>
//     <asset name="first" url="https://example.com/first.mp4" />
//     <asset name="second" url="https://example.com/second.mp4" />
//   </assets>
// </package>

const urls = document.query('**[name="asset"]:attr(url)')

console.log(urls)
// ParserNodeFragment(2) [
//   'https://example.com/first.mp4',
//   'https://example.com/second.mp4'
// ]
```

### entity

[entity.js:203-205][829]

A module for the base `Entity` used as a base class for
various porcelain classes.

#### Examples

```javascript
const { normalizeValue } = require('mediaxml/normalize')
const { Entity } = require('mediaxml/entity')
class Programme extends Entity {
  get channel() {
    return this.attributes.channel
  }

  get start() {
    return normalizeValue(this.attributes.start)
  }

  get stop() {
    return normalizeValue(this.attributes.stop)
  }
}

const node = document.query('[name="programme"]')
const programme = Programme.from(document, node)
console.log(programme.channel, programme.start, programme.stop)
```

#### Entity

[entity.js:21-175][830]

Base entity used as a base class for various porcelain classes.

##### Parameters

-   `document` **[Document][157]** The document this entity node is owned by
-   `node` **ParserNode** The node this entity represents a view over

##### Examples

```javascript
const { Entity } = require('mediaxml/entity')

class Programme extends Entity {
  get channel() {
    return this.attributes.channel
  }
}

const node = document.query('[name="programme"]')
const programme = Programme.from(document, node)
console.log(programme.channel)
```

#### query

[query/index.js:943-1128][859]

-   **See: [https://jsonata.org][655]
    **

Query the document object model represented by a node
using ["JSONata"][655] query syntax with
special selector syntax for working with {ParserNode} instances.

### JSONata functions

##### Parameters

-   `node` **ParserNode?** The parser node to query
-   `queryString` **[String][146]?** A [JSONata][655] query string (optional, default `'$'`)
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** Query options
    -   `opts.model` **[Object][147]?** An optional model to query, instead of one derived from the input `node` (optional, default `{}`)
    -   `opts.bindings` **[Object][147]?** Bindings to use instead of the ones derived from the input `node` (optional, default `node.options.bindings`)
    -   `opts.assignments` **[Object][147]??** A key-value object of variable assignments. This function will modify this object.
    -   `opts.imports` **[Map][841]??** A map of existing imports. This function will modify this map.
    -   `opts.load` **[Function][664]??** An import loader function. This function must be given if queries use the `import <path|URL>` statement.

##### Examples

```javascript
// select first node with node name "channel"
const channel = query(node, '[name="channel"]:first')
```

```javascript
// select the 'href' attribute value from the first child with a node name
// of "atom:link" from the first "channel" node
const atom = query(node, '[name="channel"]:first:children:first[name="atom:link"]:attr(href)')
```

```javascript
// select the text of the first node with a name that matches the
`/^offer:BillingId$/i` regular expression
const billingId = query(node, '[name ~> /^offer:BillingId$/i]:first:text')
```

Returns **(ParserNode | ParserNodeFragment | [String][146] | any)?** 

### normalize

[normalize.js:255-261][860]

A module that provides various normalization functions.

#### Examples

```javascript
const { normalizeKey, normalizeValue, normalizeAttributes } = require('mediaxml/normalize')
console.log(normalizeKey('Asset_ID'))
// 'assetId'

console.log(normalizeValue('2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z'))
// Date (2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z)

console.log(normalizeAttributes({ Time_Code: '00:01.5-01:00' }).timeCode)
// Timecode (00:00:01.5-00:01:00) {
//   start: Time (00:00:01.5) { value: 1.5 },
//   stop: Time (00:01:00) { value: 60 }
// }
```

#### normalizeValue

[normalize.js:56-129][861]

-   **See: [https://github.com/MelleB/tinyduration][862]
    **
-   **See: [https://github.com/little-core-labs/npt-timecode][484]
    **
-   **See: [https://github.com/CrystalComputerCorp/smpte-timecode][863]
    **

Normalize a value from a string or mixed input.

##### Parameters

-   `value` **any?** 

##### Examples

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue())
// null
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue(true))
// true
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue(false))
// true
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue('foo'))
// 'foo'
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue('123.45'))
// 123.45
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeValue('2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z'))
// Date (2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z)
```

```javascript
console.log('NPT Timecode', normalizeValue('00:45))
// Timecode (00:00:45-) { start: Time (00:45:32) { value: 2732 }, ... }
```

```javascript
console.log('SMPTE Timecode', normalizeValue('00:45:32;00'))
// Timecode  { frameRate: 29.97, dropFrame: true, .... }
```

```javascript
console.log('ISO-8601 Duration', normalizeValue('P1Y2M3DT4H5M6S'))
// { years: 1, months: 2, days: 3, ... }
```

Returns **any?** 

#### normalizeAttributes

[normalize.js:148-172][864]

Normalize attribute key-value pairs.

##### Parameters

-   `attributes`  
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 
    -   `opts.preserveConsecutiveUppercase` **[Boolean][436]?** Preserve consecutive uppercase characters in keys (optional, default `true`)
    -   `opts.normalizeValues` **[Boolean][436]?** Preserve consecutive uppercase characters in keys (optional, default `true`)
-   `attribute` **[Object][147]** 

##### Examples

```javascript
const attrs = normalizeAttributes({ Time_Code: '00:01.5-01:00' })
console.log(attrs.timeCode)
// Timecode (00:00:01.5-00:01:00) {
//   start: Time (00:00:01.5) { value: 1.5 },
//   stop: Time (00:01:00) { value: 60 }
// }
```

Returns **[Object][147]** 

#### normalizeKey

[normalize.js:190-196][865]

-   **See: [https://github.com/sindresorhus/camelcase][866]
    **

Normalize key.

##### Parameters

-   `key` **[String][146]** Key to normalize
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** Key normalization options
    -   `opts.preserveConsecutiveUppercase` **[Boolean][436]?** Preserve consecutive uppercase characters (optional, default `false`)

##### Examples

```javascript
console.log(normalizeKey('Asset_ID'))
// 'assetId'
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeKey('Asset_ID'), { preserveConsecutiveUppercase: true })
// 'assetID'
```

Returns **[String][146]** 

#### normalizeAttributeKey

[normalize.js:215-220][867]

-   **See: normalizeKey
    **
-   **See: [https://github.com/sindresorhus/camelcase][866]
    **

Normalize attribute key.

##### Parameters

-   `key` **[String][146]** Key to normalize
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** Key normalization options
    -   `opts.preserveConsecutiveUppercase` **[Boolean][436]?** Preserve consecutive uppercase characters (optional, default `true`)

##### Examples

```javascript
console.log(normalizeAttributeKey('Provider_ID'))
// 'providerID'
```

```javascript
console.log(normalizeAttributeKey('Provider_ID'), { preserveConsecutiveUppercase: false })
// 'providerId'
```

Returns **[String][146]** 

#### normalizeAttributeValue

[normalize.js:233-235][868]

-   **See: normalizeValue
    **

Normalize attribute value.

##### Parameters

-   `value` **[String][146]** Value to normalize

##### Examples

```javascript
console.log(normalizeAttributeValue('2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z'))
// Date (2021-01-23T18:12:42.963Z)
```

Returns **[String][146]** 

## fragment

[fragment.js:20-22][869]

A module that provides a container for fragment nodes.

### Examples

```javascript
const { Fragment } = require('mediaxml/fragment')
const { Text } = require('mediaxml/fragment')
const fragment = Fragment.from([Text.from('hello'), Text.from('world'), Text.from('')])
const textNodes = node.query('**[ is text and is not empty ]')
```

### Fragment

[fragment.js:8-8][870]

**Extends ParserNodeFragment**

A high level container for fragment content.

## validate

[validate.js:52-60][871]

Validates XML source input string.

### Parameters

-   `xml` **[String][146]** 


-   Throws **any** ValidationError

Returns **Boolea** 

### ValidationError

[validate.js:8-43][872]

**Extends SyntaxError**

A container for a validation error derived from a `SyntaxError` class.

#### Parameters

-   `code` **[String][146]** 
-   `message` **[String][146]** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

## validate

[validate.js:75-78][873]

-   **See: [https://github.com/NaturalIntelligence/fast-xml-parser][874]
    **

A module to provide XML validation.

### Examples

```javascript
const { validate } = require('mediaxml/validate')
try {
  validate(xml)
} catch (err) {
  // handle validation error
}
```

### ValidationError

[validate.js:8-43][872]

**Extends SyntaxError**

A container for a validation error derived from a `SyntaxError` class.

#### Parameters

-   `code` **[String][146]** 
-   `message` **[String][146]** 
-   `opts` **[Object][147]?** 

## text

[text.js:20-22][875]

A module that provides a container for text nodes.

### Examples

```javascript
const { Text } = require('mediaxml/text')
const text = Text.from('hello world')
node.appendChild(text)
const textNodes = node.query('**[ is text and is not empty ]')
```

### Text

[text.js:8-8][876]

**Extends ParserNodeText**

A high level container for text content.
